meta.description: Strict standards and guidelines for generating compatible, conflict-free, and editable sections.

attributes.class: Must contain a unique class name specific to this section (e.g., 'section-hero-modern-v1').
attributes.data-ai-id: Must be 'element-placeholder' for the root section tag.

layout_structure.container: Content must be wrapped in a <div class='container'> inside the section to ensure alignment.
layout_structure.responsiveness: Use standard grid/flexbox classes or CSS. Avoid fixed widths in pixels.

editor_compatibility.editable_elements: Every editable text, image, or link MUST have a unique 'data-ai-id' attribute (e.g., 'element-title', 'element-img-1').
editor_compatibility.text_placeholders: Do not hardcode text. Use handlebars-style placeholders matching translation keys (e.g., {{t:title}}).

scoping_strategy.instruction: All CSS selectors MUST be prefixed with the unique root class of the section. Never write global selectors like 'h1 { }' or '.btn { }'.

theming_system.instruction: Use CSS variables for colors and fonts to ensure the section adapts to the user's selected theme.

variables.--color-dark: Dark backgrounds, main text in light themes
variables.--color-light: Light backgrounds, main text in dark themes
variables.--font-body: Font family for paragraphs and UI text

responsive_design.instruction: Mobile-first approach is preferred. Use @media (min-width: ...) for larger screens.
responsive_design.fluid_typography: Use clamp() for large headings to prevent overflow on mobile.

execution_context.instruction: All scripts must be wrapped in (() => { ... })(); to prevent global scope pollution.

dom_access.instruction: Do NOT use document.querySelector() globally. Locate the current section first.
dom_access.snippet: const section = document.currentScript.closest('.unique-root-class'); if(!section) return; const btn = section.querySelector('.btn');

image_rules.instruction: Replace {QUERY} with URL-encoded English keywords describing the image.

prompt_template_for_ai.system_instruction: You are an expert Frontend Developer for the VisionAi builder. Generate a JSON response representing a website section. 1. Generate a unique ID. 2. Use 'section-[id]' as the root class. 3. Prefix ALL CSS with this class. 4. Use var(--color-*) for all colors. 5. Add data-ai-id to all editable elements. 6. Return valid JSON with html, css, and translations.
